summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan requesting permission to file a reply brief in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The reply would address the defense's opposition to the government's motion to preclude the testimony of defense expert Dr. Ryan Hall.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is addressed to her requesting permission to file a reply brief.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330). The document pertains to a motion in her trial.

persons.name: Ryan Hall
persons.context: Referred to as Dr. Ryan Hall. The defense intends to call him as an expert witness, and the government is moving to preclude his testimony.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is respectfully submitting this request to the court.

connections.description: Dr. Ryan Hall is a defense expert witness that the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, intends to call in her trial.
Damian Williams, as the U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Proposed Government Reply Brief Filing
events.description: The government proposes to file its reply brief in support of its motion to preclude Dr. Ryan Hall's testimony by noon on this date.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The government is moving to preclude the testimony of defense expert witness Dr. Ryan Hall in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The defense's opposition brief raised new arguments about hearsay exceptions applying to information in Dr. Hall's report.
The government seeks to file a reply brief specifically addressing Dr. Hall, not other experts mentioned in a broader Daubert motion.
The document is a formal request from U.S. Attorney Damian Williams to Judge Alison J. Nathan for permission to file the reply.
